title: The longer you postpone nerfing Lee, the harder you are going to have to hit him
body:
Because all these changes you put to supposedly "keep the top junglers in check" end up hurting other jungles more than them. Each and every one of those further widened the gap between the top jungles and the rest. And now Jarvan is getting hit while Lee remains untouched (what a surprise).

The wider the gap between Lee and others is, the bigger the fall he has to take. And you'll have to do it someday. People are sick of watching him every single game. People are sick of playing against this overloaded piece of shit every game.

replies.body:
Honestly with the amount of threads calling for Lee nerfs on here, reddit, and other LoL-related forums I can't help but wonder why exactly Riot refuses to touch Lee Sin if so much of the community thinks he is a big problem.

Whilst a fair amount of those threads are nonconstructive (OMG NERF LEE SIN, RIOT ONLY CARES ABOUS LC$ BIG PLAYS) I've seen plenty that *are* constructive, each one detailing parts of his kits that help put him above most other Champions just by design and ratios.

> [{quoted}](name=DrMarshSwamp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mLuAOGbt,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-18T13:10:49.546+0000)

Because for every 1 person posting a hate thread, Lee has 250 players who main him and think he is fine ready to complain at any nerf.  Also,  without reworking him entirely he cant be fixed.  They don't want to change his abilities in terms of what they do, and just changing him to do no damage is a stupid fix.  I don't play him, and I am bad at him when I have tried.  He takes skill, that much is fore sure.  The problem with that is pretty much the Orianna problem as well.  When she isn't unplayable, in the hands of very skilled players, she becomes unstoppable.

Orianna is far from unstoppable, she is the benchmark for what a balanced champion in any moba should look like.  She has a strong laning phase and can zone well but can easily push a wave with it.  Compound this with mana issues, especially since chalice got nerfed, and no mobility and she can be fairly easy to gank in retalitation.

Additionally while she does strong damage she shines most in team fights as oppose to skirmishes and with limited mobility her roaming potential is next to nothing.  Often resulting in her pushing her lane to prevent opponents from roaming, but again opening her up to ganks.

She is strong and she is safe but she isn't without exploitable weaknesses, something you can really say about trash like Yasuo/Lee/Thresh/Kalista/etc.

> 
> She is strong and she is safe but she isn't without exploitable weaknesses, something you can really say about trash like Yasuo/Lee/Thresh/Kalista/etc.

I mean you can say that all you want but it doesn't change the fact that MOST champions that are balanced around their skill level being high typically offer a BIG payout to the most skilled players.  Hence why Orianna, when not nerfed into unplayability, is always a viable pick.

Ask yourself something.


Who does Orianna force out of mid lane or make an invalid pick?


The correct answer?  Damn near no one.  She might have a random champ here and there but for the most part Orianna has existed in mid lane when Ziggs/Leblanc/Zed/Yasuo/Gragas/Lux/Morgana/etc etc have all been viable and she didn't force any of them into a state in which they where bad picks.  

That is how you know you have a balanced champ.  When the champ can be played in any meta without dictating the meta and that is exactly what describes Orianna.

"when not nerfed into unplayability, is always a viable pick."

That's not a problem.  That's called BALANCE.  Say it with me, now:  Baaaalaaance.

She isn't a must-pick, She isn't a worthless pick.  She is somewhere in the middle.

Someone (I think Morello, I could be wrong) specifically stated that nerfing Lee would cause too much backlash from his fanbase, so any changes they thought about were scrapped.

It's literally the fanbase being composed of whiners who think this overloaded POS is actually fun to play against.

The problem is that Lee Sin is actually hard to play well (although he's not between the hardest ones), and thus Lee Sin mains think that he's fair and that everybody complaining are noobs that can't play. Maybe they should tone their ego down.

I have no problem with Lee Sin in low elo. There you have those who can play him and those who can't.

When you get to Plat and above, the majority of Lee Sin players know what they're doing, and when that happens, he crowds out a lot of jungler picks. He'll counter-jungle the squishy, slow starters, and he'll gank just as hard as anyone else since he has no mana to worry about. 

In the LCS, Lee never falls out of favor, because all the pro junglers know how to use him.

I saw the post you are referring to, it was great.

You know which champions fans come out of the wood work to bitch, moan, complain, yell, scream, break glass, and shit on every Rioters toast when their champion gets nerfed?

{{champion:37}} 

Hell, a lot of her player base protested her rework, still reworked.

Guess who is a poke oriented, slow, CC bot ult, weak mana efficient early heal how explodes because the enemy decided to right click her? Still Sona.

Guess who gets nerfed because she's a poke oriented support with unavoidable damage (which requires you to put yourself into just about every ADCs range to be effective) that wasn't removed in her rework, and is really all she brings to a lane pre-6? Still Sona.

BUT HEY, ULTIMATE SKIN!

Morello, or whoever, is hiding behind something that Riot would ignore for 99% of the champion pool.
